titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Chidekel Dissertation MC.314
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-14 08:44:22 -0500.

did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
did.abstract: William Chidekel was enrolled in a Master of Arts program at New York University in the early 1950s. This collection consists of Chidekel's dissertation, "Living Accommodations in New York City, As Described by Contemporaries, 1780-1960," submitted in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the degree of Master of Arts at New York University in June 1951.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of William Chidekel's dissertation, "Living Accommodations in New York City, As Described by Contemporaries, 1780-1960," submitted in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the degree of Master of Arts at New York University in June 1951.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Charles Chidekel in February 2019; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.034.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; William Chidekel Dissertation; MC 314; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, item was rehoused in an archival box and folder, and described on the collection-level.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Chidekel was enrolled in a Master of Arts program at New York University in the early 1950s.
